reasoning: Somatoform disorders are chronic mental health conditions better measured by prevalence than incidence. WHO/DSM estimates suggest 0.5-1% lifetime prevalence (~600 per 100k). Note: DSM-5 (2013) restructured this into Somatic Symptom Disorder and other categories. Metric switched to prevalence as appropriate for chronic psychiatric condition.
source: Kirmayer LJ et al. (2004). Somatization and psychologization: understanding cultural idioms of distress. In: Pincus HA, eds. Handbook of Psychiatric Measures. Arlington: American Psychiatric Publishing
